textBeforeTable: Related Documents Additional References set ip next-hop 10.21.8.10 route-map rmap permit 10 ! neighbor 2001:DB8:yyyy::2 route-map rmap in neighbor 2001:DB8:yyyy::2 peer-group 6peers neighbor 6peers soft-reconfiguration inbound neighbor 6peers activate address-family ipv4 neighbor 2001:DB8:yyyy::2 remote-as 65002 neighbor 6peers peer-group ! router bgp 65000  The following example advertises IPv4 routes between IPv6 peers when the IPv6 network is connecting two separate IPv4 networks. Peering is configured using IPv6 addresses in the IPv4 address family configuration mode. The inbound route map named rmap sets the next hop because the advertised next hop is likely to be unreachable.   Example Advertising IPv4 Routes Between IPv6 Peers   redistribute rip address-family ipv6 unicast no bgp default ipv4-unicast router bgp 64900  The following example redistributes RIP routes into the IPv6 unicast database of the local router:   Example Redistributing Prefixes into IPv6 Multiprotocol BGP   match ipv6 address prefix-list cisco route-map rtp permit 10 ipv6 prefix-list cisco seq 10 permit 2001:DB8::/24 neighbor 2001:DB8:0:CC00::1
